name: Bytecode-modification-framework
body:
### Welcome to Bytecode Modification Framework _(BMF)_.
The Bytecode Modification Framework is a project maintained by [Matthew Coley](https://github.com/Col-E) and [Matthew Dupraz](https://github.com/MatthewDupraz) and is designed to be a light-weight Java bytecode modification library designed to accurately portray and edit class files as they are without hiding any of the inner workings.

## The TO-DO list
- [X] Access editing of classes/fields/methods
- [X] Constant pool editing
- [X] Attribute editing _(Except for CODE and STACKMAPTABLE)_
- [ ] Method opcode editing _(Requires finishing reading from CODE attribute)_
- [ ] Refactoring for class/field/method names and descriptions
- [ ] Stack analysis capabilities _(Requires finishing reading and writing from STACKMAPTABLE attribute)_
- [ ] Code cleanup and documentation

### Contact
All contact information is provided on our GitHub profiles.
* [Matthew Coley](https://github.com/Col-E)
* [Matthew Dupraz](https://github.com/MatthewDupraz)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
